parameter_description: Modulation wheel value. Destination is user-assignable via Tauntek settings.
notes: Destination set by Tauntek 'Mod CC Assign' bits (panel setting). Destinations listed on cheat sheet include VCO Mod - LFO1 Amt; VCF Cut - LFO1 Amt; VCA Mod - LFO1 Amt; LFO1 Rate; XMOD Amt; Pulse Width; VCF Cutoff; VCF Resonance.
Cheat sheet lists as on/off; exact behaviour (range/source) not specified.
Cheat sheet also lists Split Balance on CC80 with explicit 0/64/127 meaning; CC08 entry in cheat sheet does not specify mapping.
Cheat sheet does not describe the value mapping (e.g., centre/offset).

usage: 0-15: Poly 1; 16-31: Poly 2; 32-47: Unison; 48-63: Solo; 64-127: Solo Unison

notes: Cheat sheet lists CC05 as Glide Time but provides no value mapping details.
Cheat sheet notes: 0 = fast. Remaining mapping not described.
Cheat sheet lists parameter but does not provide discrete value map.
Cheat sheet lists parameter but does not provide discrete value map.
Cheat sheet specifies: 0 = full VCO1. Remaining mapping not described.

parameter_description: VCO modulation amount (mod wheel destination option).

notes: Cheat sheet formatting is slightly unclear; this is the most consistent interpretation of the listed ranges.
usage: 0-31: None; 32-63: VCO2 syncs to VCO1; 64-95: VCO1 syncs to VCO2; 96-127: Both sync

notes: Cheat sheet: Bit 3=Triangle; Bit 4=Saw; Bit 5=Pulse; Bit 6=Square. Value is a bitfield (multiple waves can be enabled).
Cheat sheet: Bit 3=Triangle; Bit 4=Saw; Bit 5=Pulse; Bit 6=Noise. Value is a bitfield (multiple waves can be enabled).
